applications.name: Adobe Acrobat Reader
applications.description: Adobe Acrobat Reader is a free PDF viewer for reading, printing, and annotating PDF documents. It includes accessibility features like screen reader support, read-out-loud functionality, keyboard navigation, and high contrast modes for inclusive document access.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift, Control, and Forward Slash together to display complete list of keyboard shortcuts.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce shortcuts reference opened. Browse shortcuts by category.

variants.keys: Page Down or Fn + Down Arrow

shortcuts.description: Press Page Down or Right Arrow to navigate to the next page in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new page number. Standard method for sequential reading.

variants.keys: Page Up or Fn + Up Arrow

shortcuts.description: Press Page Up or Left Arrow to navigate to the previous page in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous page number.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Home together to jump to the first page of the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page one. Quick navigation to document start.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and End together to jump to the last page of the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce final page number.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and N together to open page number dialog for jumping to specific page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page number dialog. Type page number and press Enter.

shortcuts.description: Press Up Arrow to scroll up in the current page without changing pages.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce visible text as viewport changes.

shortcuts.description: Press Down Arrow to scroll down in the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce text becoming visible.

shortcuts.description: Press Home to scroll to the top of the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce top of page.

shortcuts.description: Press End to scroll to the bottom of the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bottom of page.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and O together to open file browser dialog for selecting PDF to open.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce open dialog. Navigate files with arrow keys and press Enter.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and W together to close current PDF document without closing Acrobat Reader.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce document closed. Application remains open.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and S together to save a copy of the PDF with a new name.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce save dialog. Choose location and filename.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open print dialog for printing the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print dialog. Configure printer settings and page range.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and D together to view document properties including title, author, and metadata.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce properties dialog with document information.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Q together to close all documents and exit Acrobat Reader completely.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce application closing. All open PDFs will close.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Plus Sign together to zoom in and magnify the document for better readability.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce zoom percentage. Essential for users with low vision.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Minus Sign together to zoom out and see more of the page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce zoom percentage decreasing.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Zero together to fit entire page within window boundaries.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fit to window mode. Shows complete page.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 1 together to fit page width to window for easier left-to-right reading.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fit width mode. Optimizes horizontal reading.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 2 together to display document at actual size (100% zoom).
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce actual size. Shows document at original dimensions.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 4 together to enable reflow view which reformats text to fit window width.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce reflow mode. Text flows as single column without fixed layout. Improves readability for screen magnifier users.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Plus together to rotate current page view 90 degrees clockwise.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page rotated. Temporary rotation for current viewing session.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Minus together to rotate current page view 90 degrees counterclockwise.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page rotated counterclockwise.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 3 together to display one page at a time in the window.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce single page view. Shows one page per screen.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and L together to enter or exit full screen reading mode hiding toolbars and menus.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce full screen mode. Press Escape or Ctrl+L to exit. Maximizes reading area.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to open search toolbar for finding text in the document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search toolbar opened. Type search term and press Enter.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and G together to jump to next occurrence of search term in document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next match found and may read surrounding text.

variants.keys: Ctrl + Shift + G or Shift + F3

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and G together to jump to previous occurrence of search term.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous match found.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select all text content on current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce all content selected. Useful for copying text.

shortcuts.description: Press V to activate Select tool for selecting text with keyboard or mouse.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text selection tool active. Use Shift + arrow keys to select text.

shortcuts.description: Press H to activate Hand tool for dragging document and panning around page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce hand tool active. Use arrow keys to pan document.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected text to clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text copied to clipboard. Paste into other applications.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Y together to have Acrobat read current page aloud using text-to-speech.
shortcuts.notes: Acrobat announces and begins reading page content. Built-in read-aloud feature works alongside screen readers. Press Shift + Ctrl + C to stop.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and V together to start reading aloud from current page to end of document.
shortcuts.notes: Acrobat begins continuous reading. Useful for listening to entire document sections.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and E together to stop the read-aloud feature.
shortcuts.notes: Acrobat announces reading stopped. Pauses text-to-speech playback.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and C together to pause or resume reading aloud.
shortcuts.notes: Acrobat announces paused or resumed. Temporarily stops reading without ending session.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift, Control, and 5 together to open Accessibility Setup Assistant for configuring accessibility preferences.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce setup assistant. Configure reading order, colors, and screen reader options.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift, Control, and 6 together to run accessibility checker identifying accessibility issues in PDF.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce checker results. Shows missing tags, reading order issues, and other accessibility problems.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and H together to enable automatic scrolling through document at set speed.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce auto-scroll enabled. Document scrolls continuously. Useful for hands-free reading.

shortcuts.action: High contrast black text on white
shortcuts.description: Configure high contrast mode in accessibility preferences for better readability.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers work with high contrast mode. Improves visibility for low vision users. Set in Edit > Preferences > Accessibility.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to show or hide bookmarks panel for document navigation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bookmarks panel shown or hidden. Navigate bookmarks with arrow keys for quick document access.

shortcuts.description: Press F4 to show or hide page thumbnails panel for visual page navigation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce thumbnails panel. Less useful for screen reader users but available.

shortcuts.description: Press F5 to toggle left navigation pane containing bookmarks, thumbnails, and other navigation tools.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce navigation pane shown or hidden.

shortcuts.description: Press F8 to show or hide the main toolbar with document controls.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce toolbar visibility changed. Maximizes viewing area when hidden.

shortcuts.description: Press F9 to show or hide the menu bar with File, Edit, View menus.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce menu bar shown or hidden. Windows only.

shortcuts.description: Press Tab to move to next form field in fillable PDF document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce field type, label, and current value. Standard form navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab together to move to previous form field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous field information.

shortcuts.context: When checkbox or radio button has focus
shortcuts.description: Press Space to check or uncheck checkbox or select radio button in form.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce checked or unchecked state.

shortcuts.description: Press S to activate sticky note tool for adding comments to document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce sticky note tool active. Click to place note.

shortcuts.description: Press U to activate highlight tool for highlighting text in document.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce highlight tool active. Select text to highlight.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and M together to minimize Acrobat Reader window to taskbar.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce window minimized. Document remains open in background.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift, Control, and K together to arrange open PDF windows in horizontal tiles.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce window arrangement. Useful for comparing documents.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift, Control, and J together to arrange windows in cascading layout.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cascade arrangement.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Tab together to cycle through open PDF documents.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce document title as you switch. Navigate between multiple open files.
